properties.name: Room-based Camera Movement
properties.description: Demonstrates how to use the "Room based camera movement" extension for a top down action adventure/action RPG style camera.
properties.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)

events.comment: Create terrain
Remove terrain behind rooms
Remove terrain that is NOT touching a room
Use random room colors

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: RectangularFloodFill
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Create fill objects that cover the rectangular area of target objects
description: How To Use:
- Place target objects in the scene in the places you want fill objects to be created
- This action only needs to be run once (at the beginning of the scene or using TriggerOnce)
Object variables (Fill objects):
- "CreationID" (number)
- "RowID" (number)
- "ColumnID" (number)
- "BatchID" (text)
Tips:
- Use fill objects that are the same size as the scene editor grid.  This will make sure the fill objects fit exactly inside the target objects.
- Hide target objects at the beginning of the scene if you don't want them to be visible.
- Keep the default origin point (top-left corner) on fill objects them to line up exactly with target objects.

eventsFunctions.description: Create fill objects that cover the rectangular area of target objects
eventsFunctions.name: RectangularFloodFill
eventsFunctions.sentence: Create _PARAM2_ objects that will cover _PARAM1_ objects.  Space between rows:  _PARAM3_  Space between columns: _PARAM4_ Layer: _PARAM5_ Z-order: _PARAM6_ BatchID: _PARAM7_

events.comment: Initialize variables
Create a temp object to determine size of fill object, then delete it
Create permanent objects using the Create Multiple Copies of Object extension

parameters.longDescription: Rectangular area that will be covered by fill objects
parameters.name: TargetObject

parameters.longDescription: Object that is created to cover the rectangular area of target objects
parameters.name: FillObject

eventsFunctions.description:
Create multiple copies of an object.
Select the object, choose the number of rows and columns, the spacing between rows and columns, the top left starting point, the layer to create the objects on, and the z-order of the objects.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Create multiple copies of an object
eventsFunctions.name: CreateMultipleCopiesOfObject
eventsFunctions.sentence: Create _PARAM2_ rows and _PARAM3_ columns of _PARAM1_ objects, with top-left starting position _PARAM4_;_PARAM5_, with _PARAM6_px between rows and _PARAM7_px between columns. Create objects on _PARAM9_ with a Z-value of _PARAM10_. Assign all objects the BatchID of _PARAM8_.

events.comment: Temp object is created to record its width and height (which is needed to calculate spacing).
Temp variables to track progress in drawing the grid
Starting at top left, create objects in grid.
If the current row is complete, move to the next row.
If the last row is complete, stop creating new objects.

parameters.description: (Optional) Identifier assigned to all objects created in this batch
parameters.name: BatchID

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @oscuridad6661, Tristan Rhodes (@VictrisGames)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: DungeonGenerator
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Create a procedurally generated dungeon.  Includes two layouts: "rooms and hallways" and "dungeon cave"
description: How to use:
- Run the "Generate Dungeon Cave" or "Generate Dungeon with Rooms" action at the beginning of a scene.
Tips:
- Keep the amount of space used by room objects to less than ~25% of the total map.  If you add too many rooms, they will not be placed correctly and might collide with other rooms.
- Try using top-down controls combined with physics behavior (with no gravity) on the player and wall objects
- Use external layouts to place pre-designed rooms on randomly created room objects
- Use "Delete Unused Terrain" option to reduce resources used
- Use "RoomID(object)" expression to determine the starting and ending room
- Use "NeighborCount(object)" expression to find good places to place treasure.  A high amount of neighbors means that the tile is a nook or cranny.
- Use "IsRoomEntrance" condition to identify hallway objects that are adjacent to a room

eventsFunctions.description: Set the size of hallway objects to be placed on the path created by the pathfinding object.

Generate a random number between 0 and 1
Move LEFT

Move UP
Move DOWN
If ANY Walker is outside map boundries, reset ALL of them to their starting positions
Check all Walkers if they are on top of terrain
Move back to starting position
If Walker is on Terrain, delete it
Track how many steps were taken
Loop through every tile in the map
Create terrain objects when array value is 0
Create floor objects when array value is 1
Add walls
Create walls where terrain touches floor
Delete walkers

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: DraggableSliderControl
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A horizontal slider that can be dragged by the users.
description: This extension provides a behavior that draws a horizontal slider that can be dragged by the users. The value range and the tick spacing can be defined with properties.
Note that this behavior can only be attached to a **Shape Painter** object.
Further details can be found in [this tutorial video](https://youtu.be/iiTUwdAT_hs).

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (tristan@victrisgames.com)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.fullName: Create multiple copies of an object
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: CreateMultipleCopiesOfObject
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Select the object, choose the number of rows and columns, the spacing between rows and columns, the top left starting point, the layer to create the objects on, and the z-order of the objects.
description: This extension can be used to create multiple copies of an object in a wide variety of arrangements, including:
- horizontal row(s)
- vertical column(s)
- a solid rectangle or square
- an evenly spaced grid
- a grid with different spacing between rows and columns
After the objects are created, you can reference their object variables to manage the objects:
* `RowID`:  what horizontal row does this object reside in,
* `ColumnID`:  what vertical column does this object reside in,
* `CreationID`:  starting top-left, and proceeding from left to right, what is the number of the created object,
* `BatchID`:  optional identifier assigned to all objects created
Watch this [tutorial video](https://youtu.be/rlGSlNSRR9w) to see examples of how to use this extension.

eventsFunctions.description:
Create multiple copies of an object.
Select the object, choose the number of rows and columns, the spacing between rows and columns, the top left starting point, the layer to create the objects on, and the z-order of the objects.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Create multiple copies of an object
eventsFunctions.name: CreateMultipleCopiesOfObject
eventsFunctions.sentence: Create _PARAM2_ rows and _PARAM3_ columns of _PARAM1_ objects, with top-left starting position _PARAM4_;_PARAM5_, with _PARAM6_px between rows and _PARAM7_px between columns. Create objects on _PARAM9_ with a Z-value of _PARAM10_. Assign all objects the BatchID of _PARAM8_.

events.comment: Temp object is created to record its width and height (which is needed to calculate spacing).
Temp variables to track progress in drawing the grid
Starting at top left, create objects in grid.
If the current row is complete, move to the next row.
If the last row is complete, stop creating new objects.

parameters.description: (Optional) Identifier assigned to all objects created in this batch
parameters.name: BatchID

Converts a color name into a RGB string.  (Examples: black, gray, white, red, purple, green, yellow, blue)  
Full list of colors: https://www.w3schools.com/colors/colors_names.asp

inlineCode: let f = (n, k = (n + h / 30) % 12) => l - a * Math.max(Math.min(k - 3, 9 - k , 1), - 1);
console.error("Unable to convert a color: ", e);

eventsFunctions.description: Converts a color hue (range: 0 to 360) into an RGB color string with 100% saturation and 50% lightness.
eventsFunctions.name: HueToRgb

inlineCode: let f = (n, k = (n + h / 30) % 12) => l - a * Math.max(Math.min(k - 3, 9 - k , 1), - 1);
console.error("Unable to convert a color: ", e);

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Jeroen Erkens, Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: FollowObjectsWithCamera
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Change the zoom and position of the camera to keep all instances of an object (or object group) on the screen.
description: This action is meant to be run on every frame (i.e: usually you would use it without conditions, or just conditions picking the appropriate objects to track).
- Use an object group to track multiple objects.
- Only run on one layer at a time.  If multiple layers need to move the same way, create events that copy CameraX, CameraY, and CameraZoom values.
- This can also be used on a single object instance to move the camera smoothly.

eventsFunctions.description: Change the zoom and position of the camera to keep all instances of an object (or object group) on the screen
eventsFunctions.name: FollowObjectsWithCamera
eventsFunctions.sentence: Move camera on layer _PARAM6_ to keep instances of _PARAM1_ on the screen. Use a margin of _PARAM2_px horizontally and _PARAM3_px vertically. Use a zoom between _PARAM4_ and _PARAM5_.  Move the camera at a speed of _PARAM8_.

events.comment: Set default values if nothing is entered
Set initial values based on an object instance.  This is used as a valid starting point for comparisons, so it doesn't matter which instance is used.

Loop through every instance of object (or object group) and determine the max position values used for left, right, top and bottom.
Record the height and width of the objects that are on the edges.  These values will be used to increase the camera viewport to include the entire object.
Move camera to the center location
Zoom in or out to keep all object instances on screen
Adjust zoom to stay within min/max values
Change camera zoom

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: RoomBasedCameraMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Move and zoom camera to the room object that contains the trigger object
description: Move camera to the room that contains the trigger object.  If desired, change zoom to show the entire room or keep zoom static.
How to use:
- Place room objects on scene
- Select camera zoom limits, how fast the camera should move, and the visible buffer around each room
- Run this action on every frame
- Move the trigger object between rooms and camera will center on the room that contains the trigger object.
Tips:
- Use these conditions for custom logic when changing rooms : "Camera moving", "Camera zooming", and "Room changed"
- Set "Lerp Speed" to "1" to change the camera instantly

eventsFunctions.description: Move and zoom camera to the room object that contains the trigger object
